div.head: Basic document structure
div.p: A bibliographic document is intended to store information about a single original source, which may be a book, a web document or site, or a book that is scanned and available on the Internet. The root element is tei:biblStruct. Bibliographic files are support files, not full documents, so there is no TEI header.
Aside from that and a more limited element set (see below), the biblStruct concepts are identical to those presented in the TEI Guidelines.
The only major change is the introduction of the targetPattern attribute in the relatedItem tag, allowing linking to page images.

attDef.desc: Type of related item. One recommended value is scan, where target references the entirety of the scan and targetPattern references images of individual pages.

The related item's components can be found at a URL that matches the given pattern. {$page} can be used to replace a page number. If target is also supplied, the pattern must refer to the same Internet resource.
